results.title: Egghead's robot
results.creator_credit: Milo Lewis, Cecil Musk and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-a-like robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G

results.title: Egg-ceptional
results.brief_description: A deceptively simple film about an egg who doesn’t fit. Superb animation details the various stages of the production process where the egg who is ‘different’ fails to meet the required specifications. A film that operates on a number of levels ranging from lower primary concepts of colour, number and size to the more abstract concepts of conformity, individual differences, desire for acceptance, etc.

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.

results.title: Efftee entertainers
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film provides footage of the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films. These long forgotten ‘shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the 1930’s. Footage includes famous local comics, singers and dancers: Stan Ray, George Moon, Minnie Love and Keith Desmond.

results.title: Efftee's Australia
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the documentary output of Australia’s first talkie studio - Frank Thring senior’s Melbourne based Efftee Productions. All of these “shorts” have been transferred directly to video from 35 mm nitrate negatives and prints. Rated: G

results.title: Effective writing: revise and improve
results.brief_description: Illustrates various ways in which writing can be improved by reconstructing sentences, substituting better words, and using the dictionary. Depicts the tribulations of a high school student attempting to write a composition. Produces images of the content of his composition on screen as he revises and corrects his work with the help of the narrator.

results.title: Effective resumes: resumes for maximum impact
results.creator_credit: Susan Richardson, Robert Richardson Jr and Riverside Productions
results.brief_description: This American video addresses the need for every job seeker (in particular young people), to have a resume and methods for laying it out, presentation and content. It presents tips for achieving an edge over other applicants.

results.title: Effective Resumes and Job Applications
results.creator_credit: Louise Welsh Schrank, Stage Fright Productions and Learning Seed
results.brief_description: Learn how to handle job applications and resumes so that you don’t make mistakes that could cost you jobs and money. Let this video show you how to handle resumes, cover letters, and job applications. In today’s competitive job market, this video gives straightforward advice you will appreciate.

results.title: Effective Questioning in a Classroom Discussion(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Oyston and University of Lancaster (Microteaching Research Unit)
results.brief_description: The course is essentially self instructional and designed to encourage self diagnosis. It aims to produce measurable improvements in questioning techniques and thus to reduce teacher talk and increase pupil participation

results.title: Effective office communication: trainers manual [text]
results.brief_description: The manual which accompanies program of the same title contains a transcript of the dramatised episode which highlights problems with office communication and outlines some strategies to improve it. Each section of the text gives a brief introduction to the topic and presents a discussion exercise for consideration. Topics include: purposeful communication, the two-way process of communication, planning and establishing regular communication practices, the value of written communication, confidentiality, follow-up communication and using praise to motivate. The video tape may be borrowed as a separate loan item.
